content: The Diversity Visa (DV) program is a US government program that makes a certain number of visas available each year to individuals from countries with low rates of immigration to the US. To be eligible for the program, individuals must be a native of a country with low rates of immigration or meet certain other criteria, have at least a high school education or its equivalent or have at least two years of work experience within the past five years in an occupation that requires at least two years of training or experience. To apply, individuals must complete an online registration during a specific time period and provide all required information, including a recent photograph. Entries will be randomly selected by computer and individuals will be notified through the Entrant Status Check on the E-DV website. If selected, individuals must complete the DS-260, Online Immigrant Visa and Alien Registration Application and be found admissible to the United States. All selected individuals must be issued visas by September 30, 2024.
